Package ohos.miscservices.inputmethod

Class EditingText

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.inputmethod.EditingText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable

    public class EditingText
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Transfers all or updated text in the application editor to the input method.

    The content to be transferred to the input method can be all or updated text in the application editor. If all texts are transferred, the input method only needs to display the text directly in its UI. If updated text are transferred, the input method needs to update the content displayed in its UI in accordance with the transferred text. This class ensures the content consistency between the application editor and the input method.

    Since:
    3

        Parameters:

      • getSelectionStart

        public int getSelectionStart​()
        Obtains the start index of the selected text in the EditingText#getTextContent() text.

        The actual start index of the selected text in the application editor is the sum of the EditingText#getOffset() value and the return value of this method.

        Returns:
        Returns the start index of the selected text in the EditingText#getTextContent() text.
        Since:
        3

      • setSelectionStart

        Parameters:

        Since:
        3

      • getSelectionEnd

        public int getSelectionEnd​()
        Obtains the end index of the selected text in the EditingText#getTextContent() text.

        The actual end index of the selected text in the application editor is the sum of the the return value of EditingText#getOffset() and the return value of this method.

        Returns:
        Returns the end index of the selected text in the EditingText#getTextContent() text.
        Since:
        3

      • setSelectionEnd

      • getFlags

        public int getFlags​()
        Obtains the additional bit flags of the EditingText#getTextContent() text.
        Returns:
        Returns the additional bit flags of the EditingText#getTextContent() text.
        Since:
        3

      • setFlags

        public void setFlags​(int flags)
        Sets the additional bit flags of the EditingText#getTextContent() text.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the additional bit flags to set. The value is determined by the static member variables FLAG_SINGLE_LINE and FLAG_SELECTING in this class. When bit 0 of flags is 1, the current text can be edited only in a single line. When bit 1 of flags is 1, the current text enter the selection mode, which is possible only when the hardware keyboard is connected and the Shift key is latched.
        Since:
        3
